location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 100: Commodore George Robinson, Commander of the Persian Gulf Squadron, HC Sloop Clive, off Bassadore [Bāsa‘īdū, Qeshm Island], to Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: In this letter to Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Commodore George Robinson, Commander of the Persian Gulf Squadron, refers to Kemball's letter of 18 July (no. 206, the previous item in this volume) and informs him that the two slaves in question have been brought from Lingah [Bandar-e Lengeh] to Bassadore [Bāsa‘īdū, Qeshm Island]. Robinson states that of the original batch of slaves sent from Lingah four have died.
